Public Safety organizational structure

2 lieutenant subordinates

The Department of Public Safety is staffed by approximately 204 full-time security officers and 72 uniformed supervisors licensed by the State of New York. These officers report up the chain of command to the eight supervisors shown here. The

seven directors on the right report directly to Gerald Lewis.

Richard Medina

Interim executive director of CUIMC operations

Patrick Oakley

Director of Morningside operations

Vacant (formerly Maria Ramos)

Director of finance and administration

Mary Dooley

Senior administrative coordinator

Gerald Lewis

Vice president of Public Safety

Daniel Ayala (formerly Deidre Fuchs)

Interim assistant vice president of investigations

Jorge Farina

Excecutive director of technology, projects, and systems

John Murolo

Director of special operations and events

Robert Ramos

Director of Manhattanville operations

Source: Columbia University Facilities and Operations

Graphic by Tajh Martin and Adina Cazacu-De Luca

Public Safety organizational structure

2 lieutenant subordinates

The Department of Public Safety is staffed by approximately 204 full-time security officers and 72 uniformed supervisors licensed by the State of New York.

 

These officers report up the chain of command to the eight supervisors shown here. The seven directors on the right report directly to Gerald Lewis.

Richard Medina

Director of finance and administration

Mary Dooley

Senior administrative coordinator

Interim assistant vice president of investigations

Jorge Farina

Excecutive director of technology, projects, and systems

Director of special operations and events

Robert Ramos

Director of Manhattanville operations

Public Safety organizational structure

The Department of Public Safety is staffed by approximately 204 full-time security officers and 72 uniformed supervisors licensed by the State of New York. These officers report up the chain of command to the eight supervisors shown here. The seven directors on the right report directly to Gerald Lewis.
